member.name: M:SharpChess.Model.AI.Search.AlphaBetaPvs(SharpChess.Model.Player,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpChess.Model.Move,SharpChess.Model.Moves,System.Int32,SharpChess.Model.Moves)
member.summary: Performs the search foe the best move, using a specialised form of alpha beta search, named Principal Variation Search (PVS) . http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Alpha-Beta http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Principal+Variation+Search
member.param: The player to play. The player is alternated at each new ply of search.
True depth in plies. Starts at the max search depth and is DECREMENTED as alpha beta get deeper.

Variable depth which starts at the max search depth and is DECREMENTED as alpha beta get deeper. Its value is altered by search extension and reductions. Quiesence starts at depth 0. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Depth
Alpha (α) is the lower bound, representing the minimum score that a node must reach in order to change the value of a previous node. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Alpha

Beta (β) is the upper bound of a score for the node. If the node value exceeds or equals beta, it means that the opponent will avoid this node, since his guaranteed score (Alpha of the parent node) is already greater. Thus, Beta is the best-score the opponent (min-player) could archive so far... http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Beta
Move from the parent alpha beta call.

The Principal variation (PV) is a sequence of moves is considered best and therefore expect to be played. This list of moves is collected during the alpha beta search. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Principal+variation

Holds a counter indicating the number of search extensions or reductions at the current search depth. A positive nunber indicates there have been extensions in a previous ply, negative indicates a reduction. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Extensions http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Reductions
When move analysis is enabled, a tree of search moves is collected in this variable, which can be viewed in the GUI.
member.returns: The score of the best move.
member.exception: Raised when the user requests for thinking to be terminated, and immediate move to made.

member.name: M:SharpChess.Model.AI.Search.ApplyReductions(System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32,SharpChess.Model.Player,SharpChess.Model.Move,System.Int32,SharpChess.Model.Moves)
member.summary: Apply reductions to the search node. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Reductions
member.param: Number of extensions or reductions applied in the search node. Extensions positive, reductions negative.
Total number of extensions or reductions applied to the entire search tree. Extensions positive, reductions negative.
True depth in plies. Starts at the max search depth and is DECREMENTED as alpha beta get deeper.

Variable depth which starts at the max search depth and is DECREMENTED as alpha beta get deeper. Its value is altered by search extension and reductions. Quiesence starts at depth 0. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Depth
True if the search node is part of the principal variant.
True if the play-to-play is in check.
Alpha (α) is the lower bound, representing the minimum score that a node must reach in order to change the value of a previous node. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Alpha
The player to play. The player is alternated at each new ply of search.
Prinipal variant at and below this search node.

member.name: M:SharpChess.Model.AI.Search.Aspirate(SharpChess.Model.Player,SharpChess.Model.Moves,System.Int32,SharpChess.Model.Moves)
member.summary: Aspiration windows are a way to reduce the search space in an alpha-beta search. The technique is to use a guess of the expected value (usually from the last iteration in iterative deepening), and use a window around this as the alpha-beta bounds. Because the window is narrower, more beta cutoffs are achieved, and the search takes a shorter time. The drawback is that if the true score is outside this window, then a costly re-search must be made. Typical window sizes are 1/2 to 1/4 of a pawn on either side of the guess. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Aspiration+Windows http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/PVS+and+aspiration
member.param: When move analysis is enabled, a tree of search moves is collected in this variable, which can be viewed in the GUI.
Score from the previous (iterative deepending) iteration. Used as the centre of the aspiration window.
The analysis Parent Branch. When move analysis is enabled, a tree of search moves is collected in this variable, which can be viewed in the GUI.
member.returns: Score of the best move found.

member.name: M:SharpChess.Model.AI.Search.Quiesce(SharpChess.Model.Player,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,SharpChess.Model.Move,SharpChess.Model.Moves,SharpChess.Model.Moves)
member.summary: The purpose of quiescence search is to only evaluate "quiet" positions, or positions where there are no winning tactical moves to be made. This search is needed to avoid the horizon effect. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Quiescence+Search
member.param: The player to play. The player is alternated at each new ply of search.
True depth in plies. Starts at the max search depth and is DECREMENTED as alpha beta get deeper.
Depth which starts at one and INCREASES as the search deepens. Its value is altered by search extension and reductions. Quiesence starts at depth 0. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Depth
Alpha (α) is the lower bound, representing the minimum score that a node must reach in order to change the value of a previous node. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Alpha

Beta (β) is the upper bound of a score for the node. If the node value exceeds or equals beta, it means that the opponent will avoid this node, since his guaranteed score (Alpha of the parent node) is already greater. Thus, Beta is the best-score the opponent (min-player) could archive so far... http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Beta
Move from the parent alpha beta call.

The Principal variation (PV) is a sequence of moves is considered best and therefore expect to be played. This list of moves is collected during the alpha beta search. http://chessprogramming.wikispaces.com/Principal+variation
When move analysis is enabled, a tree of search moves is collected in this variable, which can be viewed in the GUI.
member.returns: The best move for the player.

member.name: T:SharpChess.Model.Fen

member.name: M:SharpChess.Model.Fen.GetBoardPosition
member.summary: Extraction the current position in FEN: Forsyth-Edwards Notation
member.returns:
string of the FEN position with 6 fields separated by " "
Piece placement data: (strbFen, strbCouldCastlingW, strbCouldCastlingB)
Active color: " w " or " b "
Castling availability: "KQkq" or "-" see (...)
En passant target square coordonates: ()
Number of ply since the last pawn advance or capturing move: ()
Full move number = Game.TurnNo \ 2 + 1

list.item: "rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/8/8/PPPPPPPP/RNBQKBNR w KQkq - 0 1" initial position
"rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/4P3/8/PPPP1PPP/RNBQKBNR b KQkq e3 0 1" after 1. e4
"rnbqkbnr/pppp1ppp/8/4p3/4P3/8/PPPP1PPP/RNBQKBNR w KQkq e6 0 2" after 1. e4 e5
"rnbqkbnr/pppp1ppp/8/4p3/4P3/5N2/PPPP1PPP/RNBQKB1R b KQkq - 1 2" after 2. Nf3
"r1bqkbnr/pppp1ppp/2n5/4p3/4P3/5N2/PPPP1PPP/RNBQKB1R w KQkq - 2 3" after 2. Nf3 Nc6
"r1bqkbnr/pppp1ppp/2n5/1B2p3/4P3/5N2/PPPP1PPP/RNBQK2R b KQkq - 3 3" after 3. Bb5
"r1bqkbnr/1ppp1ppp/p1n5/1B2p3/4P3/5N2/PPPP1PPP/RNBQK2R w KQkq - 0 4" after 3. Bb5 a6

Field 2: (arrStrFen[1]) Active color
Field 3: (arrStrFen[2]) Castling availability
Field 4: (arrStrFen[3]) En passant target square coordonates

member.name: M:SharpChess.Model.Fen.FenGet1Pieces(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: FEN piece placement string by rank 7..0 and by file 0..7
member.param: string builder FEN of the chessboard

list.item: strbFen = "rnbqkbnr/pppppppp/8/8/4P3/8/PPPP1PPP/RNBQKBNR" for the intial position
"r" = Black rook, "n" = Black knight,... "p" = Black pawn
"R" = White rook, "N" = White knight,... "P" = White pawn
"4P3" means 4 empty squares before the White pawn, then 3 empty squares
"8" means empty rank

member.name: M:SharpChess.Model.Fen.FenGet3CastlingIsPossible(SharpChess.Model.Piece,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: FEN notation of castling availability of the King in the future

list.item: append "K" if White castling availability
append "Q" if White castling availability both
append "k" if Black castling availability both Rook-side
append "q" if Black castling availability both Queen-side
append "KQkq" if O-O and O-O-O for White first then Black

member.name: M:SharpChess.Model.Fen.FenGet4EnPassant
member.summary: FEN string indicating the potential square target for a capture en passant

list.item: "e3" if the last move was e2-e4
"e6" if the last move was e7-e5
" - " if the last move was not a pawn move of 2 squares

member.name: T:SharpChess.Model.Piece
member.summary: Represents the base of a chess piece i.e. the but that sits on a chess square. A piece can have different tops e.g. A Pawn, Queen, Bishop etc. The top of a piece is changed when a piece is promoted. e.g. A pawn is promoted to a Queen. The piece "base" determines its location. The piece "top" determines it type (Queen, pawn etc) and value.

member.name: P:SharpChess.Model.PlayerClock.ControlPeriod
member.summary: Gets a value that is used to automatically reset the "number of moves remaining" back to "Clock Max Moves", when the number of player moves exceeds "ClockMaxMoves". e.g. The clock is set at 120 moves in 60 minutes. At the beginning of the game we're in Control Period 1. If the player gets to move 121 then we move into Control Period 2. So the Control Period increments by 1, every 120 moves, effectively allowing play to continue, and the clock to continue functioning.

member.name: P:SharpChess.Model.PlayerClock.IsTicking
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the player's clock is ticking. A player's clock ticks during their turn, and and is suspended during their opponent's turn.

member.name: P:SharpChess.Model.PlayerClock.MovesRemaining
member.summary: Gets the number of move that the player has remaining, when the clock has a move limit e.g. 120 moves in 60 minutes. When the remaining moves run out, then it is automatically re-extended (see ControlPeriod).

member.name: P:SharpChess.Model.PlayerClock.TimeElapsed
member.summary: Gets or sets the players elapsed turn time. The clock ticks during the player's turn and is suspended during the opponents turn.

member.summary: Gets the clock's elapsed time suitable for textual display.
